name: tap water production, conventional treatment | tap water | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20291/documentation

This dataset represents production of 1 kg of tap water under pressure at facility gate, ready for distribution in network. It represents average operation of conventional treatment for production tap water. Conventional treatment includes coagulation, flocculation and decantation. In some occasions the treatment also includes, chemical application, filtration, pH stabilization and/or softening, which can be present in some plants. Inventory was constructed from reported chemicals, energy inputs and wastes from 6 distinct conventional plants located in Colombia

This activity starts from tap water, under pressure, at tap water treatment plant and fed into tap water distribution network.

This dataset ends with the production of tap water, at facility gate, under pressure. It includes energy for intake pumping and treatment system, as well as the energy of the pump pressurizing water to the beginning of the network. It includes all chemicals and material added to the water during treatment. It excludes energy for pumping stations and water losses within the network as they are included in the tap water market. Emissions to the environment occurring during the treatment and during the distribution were not considered as they are assumed negligible. Main substance in water that would be released in the environment are assumed to be considered in wastewater processes.
category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/36:Water collection, treatment and supply/360:Water collection, treatment and supply/3600:Water collection, treatment and supply

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The time period is set from 2012 to the year 2017 as it is a considering period in which conventional treatment plants have not passed through drastic technological changes.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Extrapolated from data from six conventional treatment plants in Colombia. The uncertainty was adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Most Frequent technology in tap water production facility in Colombia
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: From 6 conventional tap water production facilities to all conventional facility in Colombia. Conventional treatment accounts for 86% of the total produced tap water in Colombia. Data was used for regionalizing chemicals and energy exchanges, the remianing exchanges were copied from the global dataset,The uncertainty has been changed accordingly.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Based on data from 6 local conventional treatment plants representing 20.6% of the total produced tap water in Colombia. Conventional tap production facilities were regionalized in accordance to these 6 Colombian Treatment plants, of which 4 are located in Pamplona (Orlando, Rodriguez, Villamizar-gallardo, & García, 2016), 1 in Medellin (EPM, 2016) and 1 in Pereira (Varón Hoyos, 2015). Data was taken from LCA national studied reports for 5 of the 6 treatment plants, in Medellin"s case data comes from primary source (written communication from Empresas Públicas de Medellin, EPM)

exchanges.description: Calculated value. It is assumed that the treatment process itselve have 3.3% losses and that 9% of the water is supplied by the lakes and 91% by rivers, similar to the GLO dataset.

flow.name: Water, lake
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/in water

exchanges.description: Measured value. Average use of lime for pH adjustment in 6 assessed conventional treatment plants in Colombia, according to LCA reports/written communication [(Orlando, Rodriguez, Villamizar-gallardo, & García, 2016), (Varón Hoyos, 2015) , (EPM, 2016)]. Note than 3 of the 6 conventional plants reported using this substance. Plants not reporting this consumable were attributed an input value of 0 during the calculation of the weighted average. This avoided double functional equivalent chemical inputs.

exchanges.description: Measured value. Average electricity consumption for entire process including pumping for water intake and pumping for distribution at the plant gate, according to 6 colombian treatment plants LCA reports/ written communication [(Orlando, Rodriguez, Villamizar-gallardo, & García, 2016), (Varón Hoyos, 2015) , (EPM, 2016)]. All 6 plant reported electricity use. Values reported varied from 1.31e-3 to 2.574e-6 kWh/kg.

exchanges.description: Calculated value. This mathematical relation was taken from the "tap water production, conventional treatment, GLO" dataset (accessed 20170920) as it was considered adequate also for this dataset. Amount of water works construction attributed to the production of 1kg of tap water. Value is based on assumed lifetime production of water treatment plant and an assumed typical medium-sized plant of 30,000 m3/day.

exchanges.description: Measured value. Average use of coagulants (Clarifloc, AK 23 coagulant) in 6 Colombian treatment plants, according to LCA reports/ written communication [(Orlando, Rodriguez, Villamizar-gallardo, & García, 2016), (Varón Hoyos, 2015) , (EPM, 2016)]. Note that 3 of the 6 conventional plants reported using either of these two substances. Plants not reporting these consumables were attributed an input value of 0 during the calculation of the weighted average. This avoided double functional equivalent chemical inputs.
